metadata.title: CVE-2018-5333 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel through 4.14.13, the rds_cmsg_atomic function innet/rds/rdma.c mishandles cases where page pinning fails or an invalidaddress is supplied, leading to an rds_atomic_free_op NULL pointerdereference.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5333` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-119-generic - 4.4.0-119.143
linux-image-4.4.0-119-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-119.143
linux-image-4.4.0-119-lowlatency - 4.4.0-119.143
linux-image-4.4.0-119-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-119.143
linux-image-4.4.0-119-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-119.143
linux-image-4.4.0-119-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-119.143
linux-image-4.4.0-119-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-119.143
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-119-generic - 4.4.0-119.143
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1086-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1086.94
No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-41-lowlatency - 4.13.0-41.46~16.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-41-generic - 4.13.0-41.46~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1014-azure - 4.13.0-1014.17

No subscription required

linux-image-extra-4.13.0-1012-gcp - 4.13.0-1012.16
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-119.143').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1086.94').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1088.93').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1054.63').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-41.46~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1014.17').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1012.16').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1020.25').
linux-euclid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-oem package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1022.24').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips/xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-1017.22~recert1').
linux-oracle package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1').
